bug.author: velikodniy
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>ğŸ› Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: aug = albumentations.Compose( [albumentations.pytorch.ToTensor()], additional_targets={'image2': 'image'} )
out = aug(image=image, image2=image) <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
I expected types of image and image2 to be torch.Tensor, but ToTensor() was applied only to image target (this behaviour is hard coded as far as I understand). type(out['image']), type(out['image2']) returns <denchmark-code>(torch.Tensor, numpy.ndarray) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
Albumentations version: 0.2.2 Python version: 3.7.2 OS: Ubuntu 18.04 How you installed albumentations (conda, pip, source): pip Any other relevant information: â€”
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
â€”
